subject: packaging: Fix the build on x86_64; resolve rpmlint error
commitMessage:
packaging: Fix the build on x86_64; resolve rpmlint error

The previous commit broke the build for x86_64, since %{_libdir} will
expand to /usr/lib64 for this arch. Also, systemd would not recognize
the /usr/lib64/sysctl.d directory, so /usr/lib/sysctl.d must stay
hardcoded.

Additionally, change RPM group tag to resolve an rpmlint error.

Change-Id: I071161458527499f3bcf55d1622c24febb952602
Signed-off-by: Patrick McCarty <patrick.mccarty@linux.intel.com>

subject: Set Smack label on crash and crash/info PTREL-544
commitMessage:
Set Smack label on crash and crash/info PTREL-544

Set the Smack label on /opt/share/crash and /opt/share/crash/info
to System::Log. This will allow System and User processes to create
crash reports there. These directories are not marked as transmuting
because we don't want System and User looking at each other's crashes.

Bug-Tizen: PTREL-544
Signed-off-by: Casey Schaufler <casey.schaufer@intel.com>

Change-Id: Id5c665fa6f285e0e1199f36b3b5927f1e34d9107

subject: Update /etc/ld.so.preload after un-installing the package
commitMessage:
Update /etc/ld.so.preload after un-installing the package

Add %postun script to the spec file that removes the entry for libsys-assert.so
from the /etc/ld.so.preload file with the bash script way, using sed

Bug-Tizen: PTREL-11
Change-Id: If3c88b5c42fe9f9b66d208f63d30e8eaacc74d90
Signed-off-by: Ravi Nanjundappa <nravi.n@samsung.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 -Code-Review

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

There is no need to abandon your previous change if you are amending a commit. You can do a 'git commit --amend', and push again with 'git push remotename HEAD:refs/for/tizen', and Gerrit will create a second patch set for you.

More comments inline.

Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Patch Set 1:

I would also recommend adding "Requires(postun): sed" in the rpm header, as Mikko suggested in https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/#/c/14898/ .
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Incorporated the suggestions from Mr.Patrick and Mr.Mikko. Used git commit --amend to generate the second patch set.
Please review this change.

Patch Set 2: -Verified

I just tried a local build without "Requires(postun): sed" and tested in the emulator. It works fine without the sed dependency.
Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Looks good aside from one issue. See my inline comment.
Uploaded patch set 3.

Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Updated. Pls review.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Looks good, thanks!

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Please fix the commit message according to

http://bit.ly/goodcommitmessages

https://wiki.tizen.org/wiki/Talk:Packaging/Guidelines#PROPOSAL

Something like

 Update /etc/ld.so.preload after removing the package

 Add %postun script to the spec file that removes the entry for
 libsys-assert.so from the /etc/ld.so.preload file.

 Tizen-Bug: PTREL-11
 Change-Id: If3c88b5c42fe9f9b66d208f63d30e8eaacc74d90
 Signed-off-by: nravi <nravi.n@samsung.com>

will look better. Please put your real name in the signed-off-by line before the e-mail address.
Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2
Uploaded patch set 4.

Patch Set 4: Verified+1

hi, 

I've updated the commit message as per Mr. Lukasz Stelmach's inputs. 
I hope this should be fine. 
Please review the same.
Uploaded patch set 5.
Patch Set 5: Verified+1
Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 5:

"rpm -q -p --scripts sys-assert-0.3.3-5.<arch>.rpm" 
confirms that _libdir translates to  /usr/lib
Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2
Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

subject: remove core-launcher
commitMessage:
remove core-launcher

It is not use no more.
so remove that source.
and chmod /opt/share/crash directory.
